Reviews.Title: “Looks basic but actually is fantastic. Ideal for travellers.”
Reviews.Author: BrightonPurplestar
Reviews.Content: I couldn't help but be disappointed when I first arrived because I'm used to higher-spec hotels than this, but I'm currently travelling around Italy so needs must. HOWEVER, 10 mins after I arrived I realised how lucky I was to find it. I paid 55 euros per night, with breakfast included, via Booking.com. I did hear someone come in who didn't have a booking though and the guy at reception told her it was 30 euros per head per night, though I suspect breakfast is not included in that, but shows you what the mark up by Booking.com is! Maybe contact the hotel directly. Location - 30 SECONDS AWAY FROM ROMA TERMINI STATION!! If you come out of the main entrance at the front, or to the left, cross over the road, walk down one block and the hotel in on that street. I asked for directions at the Tourist Information desk in the station when I arrived which is near platform 24. The room was pokey to say the least, but actually it is perfect for one person. Single bed with 'ensuite' wet room attached - toilet, sink and incredibly powerful shower, which is lovely to get the grime off. My only slight worry is the light switch IN the wet room. It also has a hairdryer, which I didn't use. FREE WIFI in my room - you just ask the guy at the reception for the code to connect and the connection never failed, and I was Skyping, iChat, FactTime, email, searching the net, the lot! Room is really clean - I inspected the bed and mattress thoroughly - looks brand new! The guys on the reception, especially at night (a Singaporean who's been in Italy 20 years) are lovely and really helpful! All speak English, which with my broken Italian was also helpful. Air conditioning in the room, which is a god send because it is very hot! The walls are quite thin and you can hear people coming in through the night, but you'll be so tired trekking round the glorious city of Rome that it won't matter. Room also has a TV, but I haven't used it at all. The street can also be quite noisy, but that's due to the location, which is PERFECT! Breakfast is not served in the hotel. If you have it included in your booking, they give you a voucher to go to the Pizzeria/Cafe diagonally across from the hotel, and I was given a gorgeous coffee (you can choose, cappuccino, latte etc) and a croissant. It was delicious, but DON'T GO TO THE SAME PLACE FOR DINNER - made that mistake. Horrible, and I only ordered pasta with a tomato sauce. It was ready in about 30 seconds - that says it all! Happy holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Central, cheap (ish), basic, clean”
Reviews.Author: AUS_MAP_IT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Concorde because we wanted to be near the airport bus for a very early flight the next day and also close to Termini. If you want to stay centrally in Rome and in a reasonable hotel then I would recommend Hotel Concorde. It is basic, clean, good location, not too noisey, walking distance to a lot of things, restaurants, sites, train etc...Hotels in Rome are not the cheapest so we thought this was a bit expensive for what we are used to but looking at prices in Rome this was the average price for that area and that quality hotel. We had a room with two balconies that had great city views. Reception staff were good. Beds comfortable. Tv and air conditioning if you like those comforts as well. The hotel is on the 5th and 6th floors.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: m3resources Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We are not a couple that needs the best of everything so this review is coming from a pretty conservative perspective. I researched online for hours and read all the reviews and I am still baffled by how this hotel received good reviews. First we arrived and they put us in the room that had not even been cleaned.....so we put our stuff down and quickly left. The bed was two mattresses pushed together on a cot with no middle divider, the bathroom was tiny and you had to take a shower in between the toilet and the sink and the room was tiny. The walls are extremely thin and you can hear people talk and come in and out of their rooms at all hours of the night. After our first night we saw that they were cleaning out the room next to us which looked much nicer, we inquired if we could switch rooms at 10AM and they said, no they were booked full. Even when we said the next guest can simply have our room.....they conveniently didn't speak English at that point. Very disappointing in everything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaMartina
Reviews.Content: After a mix up with my booked hotel I landed in Hotel Concorde. The employees were very kind. Breakfast was good. The hotel room was simple, but clean and noise free. A fine hotel if you want to visit rome and only need a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charged wrongly”
Reviews.Author: rao_aparna
Reviews.Content: Forget staying in this hotel, dont even make a booking or you will be wrongly charged.I made a booking with booking.com for 2nd & 3rd April 2010. I cancelled the booking on 20th March. The policy said that I will not be charged if I cancel on or before 30th March. Guess what, my credit card has been charged on 27th March with 98 euros !! and I have been frantically trying to get a reply from the hotel. If you value your hard earned money, dont even make a booking with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: tanaval
Reviews.Content: I find some of the former reviews to be unfair. The area around Termini station is not the most upscale, but it is not dangerous and for a lot of us who are in Rome for a limited time, the convenience of being near Termini is huge in terms of efficiency. The Concorde is a couple of floors of a high rise building but many, many hotels that handle tourists in Rome are the same, in fact it is typical to find 3 or 4 hotels in the same building, just different floors. This hotel is quite clean, you can absolutely come and go at any time and so what if you have to ring a bell to get the attendant in the middle of the night? That is most small hotels in Europe. If you want American hotels then stay in America, this is Europe and things are different, not necessarily worse but different. Criticizing this is unfair. Breakfast was better than most Rome hotel breakfasts and coffee/roll etc is typical breakfast in Rome for any hotel. And it is good and served with a smile. As for carrying luggage up the stairs, there is an elevator, you just might have to wait for it some, so what? To me, it is clean, central, comfortable, I was treated well, it is not unsafe, it is fine. I was traveling with my kids and they liked it, I never felt they were unsafe, but then again I didn't have them out walking around in the middle of the night. You do have to watch the pickpockets here, even more than elsewhere in Rome, which is famous for pickpockets...watch the little kids, that is who does it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but OK - and good value”
Reviews.Author: Jandor
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Concorde Hotel unexpectedly, after a mistake by our travel agent meant that we arrived in Rome at 7 in the evening with no hotel to go to! So, I suppose we were grateful for whatever we could get. We were in a little room on the top floor. It was quite small and basic, but clean and it had an ensuite wetroom. We found that we could walk to all the major sights from the hotel without the need for taxis or public transport. All in all we had an enjoyable time and thought the hotel was good value for money, especially as it was so near to all the major sights. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as it seems”
Reviews.Author: jadeforester
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Concorde Hotel with 39 other students (aged between 13 and 17), and 5 members of staff, and although the hotel is not the most easily accessible (yes, it is located on the 5th and 6th floors), most of us students carried our luggage up all 6 flights of stairs, with our only complaint being that the teachers insisted that they used the lift most of the time! And the fact that the hotel did not serve breakfast but directed us to a cafe waas actually very nice, as it meant we could be up and out much more quickly without having to go back to our rooms to collect items for the day etc. Considering the size and ages of our group, I felt that Hotel Concorde received us very well, as it is difficult to have that many children running around and being noisy (which many of our group were). Many hotels do not accept school groups, and I think that although the hotel is not the best furnished or air-conditioned, its attitude to any problems was amazing considering the strain we put them under.
